title: Ant McPartlin's ex-wife Lisa Armstrong celebrates her birthday ... days after getting judge role
text:
She's recently been announced as a guest judge on Stacey Dooley's BBC Three show Glow Up after impressing the presenter with her beauty skills.

And Ant McPartlin's ex-wife Lisa Armstrong had another occasion to celebrate on Sunday as she raised a glass to her birthday.

The make-up artist, who turned 43 on Friday, looked fabulous as she sat next to her mother Linda in an Instagram post shared with her 51.1K followers on Sunday.

Birthday celebrations: Lisa Armstrong looked fantastic as she enjoyed a drink with her mother Linda to celebrate turning 43

Lisa's blonde tresses looked stylish in a coiffed do and she appeared to have kept her makeup simple for the celebrations, adding a touch of lipstick.

Mother Linda looked equally chic as she lifted a bottle of champagne while wearing a polka dot shirt which she accessorised with a pair of stud earrings.

The make-up artist captioned her post: 'Celebrating my birthday with mama ... #lovehersomuch!! @lindaarmstrong6220 #shesthebest x'

Exciting: On Thursday it was revealed Lisa will be a guest judge on Stacey Dooley's BBC Three show Glow Up after impressing the presenter with her make-up skills on Strictly

The celebrations come after Lisa was revealed to be a guest judge on Stacey Dooley's BBC Three show Glow Up.

She has already filmed the talent series which follows ten make-up artists on their journey to become Britain's next make-up star.

With different creative briefs each week, they will need to impress Val Garland (Global Make-Up Director for L’Oreal Paris), Dominic Skinner (Global Senior Artist for MAC) and expert guest judges in order to make it to the final.

Family: Lisa, who is currently head of make-up and hair on Strictly Come Dancing, often posts snaps with her mum. They are pictured together in July celebrating Linda's birthday

Lisa's representative confirmed the news to MailOnline on Thursday and revealed that show has already been filmed. BBC has been approached for further comment.

It comes after a source told The Sun: 'When Lisa was with Ant she very much took the back seat. He was the TV star and a career on screen didn’t massively appeal to her.

'But she has been truly scooped up by the BBC and her Strictly family so when this offer came through to be a guest judge on Stacey’s show Glow Up, and it was the Beeb, she jumped at the chance.

Fun: Lisa has already filmed the talent series which follows ten make-up artists on their journey to become Britain's next make-up star hosted by Stacey Dooley (pictured)

Busy bee: Lisa's representative confirmed the news to MailOnline and revealed the show has already been filmed

'She's really good on camera and is a leader in the make-up industry, so it makes sense.'

Lisa is currently head of make-up and hair on Strictly Come Dancing and she gives beauty tutorials on spin-off show It Takes Two, she previously worked on Britain's Got Talent.

While Glow Up, which was announced last year and hosted by Stacey, sees ten contestants live and work together as they compete to win a contract assisting some of the world's biggest make-up artists.

With different creative briefs each week, they will need to impress Val, Dominic and expert guest judges from worlds such as fashion and film, in order to make it to the final.

Premise: With different creative briefs each week, they will need to impress Val Garland (Global Make-Up Director for L’Oreal Paris), Dominic Skinner (Global Senior Artist for MAC) and expert guest judges in order to make it to the final (Val, Dominic and Stacey pictured)

Earlier this year, host Stacey responded to criticism that her latest presenting gig was 'trivial' compared to her investigative reporting in places like Iraq.

She told the Mail on Sunday's YOU magazine that after some of her more grim programmes, 'it seemed really important to me to be at home and enjoy some escapism'.

And responding to the backlash, she said: ‘It’s painfully predictable. There are always people who are desperate to put you in your one camp and never let you leave.

'The idea that you could be interested in the Yazidi community and also in lipstick blows people’s minds.

'It’s a really short-sighted, Stone Age attitude – it’s boring, actually.'
description: Lisa Armstrong, 43, looked fantastic as she raised a glass and celebrated her birthday with mother Linda in an Instagram post shared on Sunday.
